info.title: SYMMIO Hybrid Exchange(SHE)
info.description:
This is the API for a SYMMIO Hybrid Exchange(SHE).

## Key Features:

* **REST Endpoints:** For traditional request/response operations like fetching market data, user information, etc.
* **WebSocket Streams:** Provides real-time updates for market data (trades and order book).

### WebSocket Usage:

**Note:** Swagger UI does not natively support direct testing of WebSocket connections. To use these endpoints, you will need a dedicated WebSocket client (e.g., `wscat`, Postman, WebSocket browser APIs, or a custom script).

**1. Real-time Trades Stream (`/ws/trades/{symbol}`):**
* **Endpoint:** `ws://DOMAIN/ws/trades/{symbol}`
* **Description:** Connect to this endpoint to receive a continuous stream of executed trade events for a specific trading `symbol` (e.g., `BTCUSDT`).
* **Messages:** You will receive JSON messages, in the format of `TradeEvent`.

**Parameters:**
* `symbol`: `str` - Trading pair symbol, e.g., `BTCUSDT` (from path).

**Response Keys (from `TradeEvent`):**
* `e`: `str` - Event type (`"trade"`).
* `E`: `int` - Event time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds).
* `s`: `str` - Symbol, e.g., `BTCUSDT`.
* `a`: `int` - Aggregate trade ID.
* `p`: `Decimal` - Price.
* `q`: `Decimal` - Quantity.
* `T`: `int` - Trade time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds).
* `m`: `bool` - Is the buyer the market maker?


**Example Connection (using `wscat`):**
```bash
wscat -c ws://DOMAIN/ws/trades/BTCUSDT
```

**Example Python Client:**
```python
import asyncio
import websockets

async def connect_trades():
    uri = "ws://[DOMAIN/ws/trades/BTCUSDT](https://DOMAIN/ws/trades/BTCUSDT)"
    async with websockets.connect(uri) as websocket:
        print(f"Connected to {uri}")
        try:
            while True:
                message = await websocket.recv()
                print(f"Received trade: {message}")
        except websockets.exceptions.ConnectionClosedOK:
            print("Connection closed normally.")
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(connect_trades())
```

**2. Real-time Order Book Stream (`/ws/orderbook/{symbol}`):**
* **Endpoint:** `ws://DOMAIN/ws/orderbook/{symbol}`
* **Description:** Connect to this endpoint to receive real-time updates to the order book for a specific trading `symbol`. These updates  contain bids and asks at various price levels.
* **Messages:** You will receive JSON messages,  in the format of `OrderbookEvent`.

**Parameters:**
* `symbol`: `str` - Trading pair symbol, e.g., `ETHUSDT` (from path).

**Response Keys (from `OrderBookEvent`)**:
* ``e``: `str` - Event type (`"orderbook"`).
* ``E``: `int` - Event time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds).
* ``s``: `str` - Symbol, e.g., `ETHUSDT`.
* ``u``: `int` - Final update ID in event.
* ``b``: `List[List[Decimal]]` - Bids array: `[[price, quantity], ...]`.
* ``a``: `List[List[Decimal]]` - Asks array: `[[price, quantity], ...]`.

**Example Connection (using `wscat`):**
```bash
wscat -c ws://DOMAIN/ws/orderbook/ETHUSDT
```
    
**Example Python Client:**
```python
import asyncio
import websockets

async def connect_orderbook():
    uri = "ws://[DOMAIN/ws/orderbook/ETHUSDT](https://DOMAIN/ws/orderbook/ETHUSDT)"
    async with websockets.connect(uri) as websocket:
        print(f"Connected to {uri}")
        try:
            while True:
                message = await websocket.recv()
                print(f"Received orderbook: {message}")
        except websockets.exceptions.ConnectionClosedOK:
            print("Connection closed normally.")
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    asyncio.run(connect_orderbook())
```

get.description: Retrieve information about all available trading pairs.

200.description: List of market information retrieved successfully

get.description: Retrieve current market data (ticker) for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT).

404.description: Ticker not found for the specified symbol

get.description: Retrieve the current order book for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT) with a specified limit of bid/ask entries.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Number of bid/ask entries to return (10, 20, 50, 100, 500, 1000)

parameters.description: Number of bid/ask entries to return (10, 20, 50, 100, 500, 1000)

404.description: Order book not found for the specified symbol

get.description: Retrieve recent trades for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT), up to a specified limit.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of trades to return (1 to 1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of trades to return (1 to 1000)

200.description: List of recent trades retrieved successfully

get.description: Retrieve OHLCV (candlestick) data for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT) and timeframe.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of candlestick entries to return (1 to 1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of candlestick entries to return (1 to 1000)

post.description: Create a new order for a specified trading pair.

delete.description: Cancel an existing order by specifying its order_id and trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT).

parameters.name: id

schema.description: The unique order_id of the order to cancel
schema.title: Id

parameters.description: The unique order_id of the order to cancel

400.description: Order cannot be canceled (e.g., not open) or symbol mismatch

get.description: Retrieve an order by specifying its order_id and trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT).

parameters.name: id

schema.description: The unique order_id of the order to retrieve
schema.title: Id

parameters.description: The unique order_id of the order to retrieve

get.description: Retrieve all open orders for user

schema.title: Response List Open Orders Orders Open Get

get.description: Retrieve the authenticated user's trade history.

schema.title: Response Get My Trades My Trades Get

404.description: No trades found for the user

get.description: Retrieve user account information includes its account balance and all positions for the authenticated user

200.description: Account Info and List of positions retrieved successfully

get.description: Retrieve all positions for the authenticated user, up to a specified limit.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of positions to return (1 to 1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of positions to return (1 to 1000)

get.description: Retrieve the position for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT).

404.description: No position found for the specified symbol

post.description: Set the leverage for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT).
Set the margin mode (cross or isolated) for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT).
Set the position mode (one-way or hedge) for the authenticated user.

get.description: Retrieve the latest funding rate for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT).

404.description: No funding rate found for the specified symbol

get.description: Retrieve the funding rate history for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT), up to a specified limit.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of funding rate history entries to return (1 to 1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of funding rate history entries to return (1 to 1000)

schema.title: Response Get Funding Rate History Funding Rate History Get

get.description: Retrieve the funding rate history for a specified trading pair symbol (e.g., BTCUSDT), up to a specified limit. Requires authentication.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of funding history entries to return (1 to 1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of funding history entries to return (1 to 1000)

schema.title: Response Get Funding History Funding History Get

post.description: Generate a signature for the given request parameters. Requires API key and private key.

schema.title: Response Get Users Dev Users Get

post.description: Admin route to deposit or withdraw funds for a user.

400.description: Invalid request or insufficient funds for withdraw

404.description: Target user or currency not found

price.title: Price
price.description: Required for limit orders, ignored for market orders
